alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Reeves County Plains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Pecos and southeastern Reeves Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 330 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 23 miles west of Fort Stockton, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Pecos and southeastern Reeves Counties. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 226 and 239. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.
